page.title: 18AUCHINLECK 1939-45 SOCIAL
page.content: Auchinleck Red Cross organised nightly dances which were very popular with both the troops stationed at Pennylands Camp and the villagers. The large number of troops with their regular pay helped local trade and also regularly attracted many street traders from as far as Glasgow to sell their wares from suitcases. Rationing existed during and after the war but the amount of money spent in the village by the troops created a market for 'luxury'goods,resulting in a letter from a repatriated Pole to a local trader saying 'he could have bought a horse and cart in Poland for what he paid for pepper in Auchinleck'. Some Polish soldiers stayed to marry local girls and there are still families of Polish extraction in the village.
